      • XHTMLEditor

        public XHTMLEditor(Map<Enum<?>,LocalizedObjectKey> dataPurposes)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        dataPurposes - the data purposes. Each matching Model Data is rendered in its own tab using the specified LocalizedObjectKey. Only a single model data is supported per data purpose.

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        public CmsModelDataSet commit(PageElement pageElement)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Commit changes in the UI to the specified PageElement and return a new CmsModelDataSet.

        This is always called after Editor.validate(Notifiable) and only if validate returns a "success" value.

        Specified by:
        commit in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        pageElement - the PageElement to update with changes.
        Returns:
        the new CmsModelDataSet. If Editor.isModelDataDirty(EditorUI) returned true then this class should not return null. If Editor.isModelDataDirty(EditorUI) returned false it should return null.

      • createFieldComponent

        protected Field createFieldComponent(Enum<?> dataPurpose)
        Create a new field component.
        Parameters:
        dataPurpose - the data purpose the field component is being created for.
        Returns:
        the field component.

      • createUI

        public void createUI(EditorUI editorUI)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Create the UI.

        Initialize the editor and update the UI with MIWT components required by the editor. Don't store the EditorUI for later reference. All work related to the EditorUI or its properties should be done before this method returns. Any work done outside this method on the EditorUI or properties returned from it is undefined and may result in error.

        Specified by:
        createUI in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        editorUI - the EditorUI.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Destroy the editor; releasing any resources that have been allocated. This method is guaranteed to be called only once.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface Editor

      • getDataPurposeHeader

        protected Component getDataPurposeHeader(Enum<?> dataPurpose)
        Get the header component for the specified data purpose.

        This is typically instructions on what to enter into the field component.

        Parameters:
        dataPurpose - the data purpose.
        Returns:
        the component or null.

      • getDefaultRTEConfig

        public static String getDefaultRTEConfig()
        Get the default RTE Config.
        Returns:
        the default.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(PageElement pageElement)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Initialize the editor for the specified PageElement. This is the first method that is called after instantiation. This method is guaranteed to be called only once.

        After this method call, the PageElement will become detached. If your code needs to access / initialize a proxied property, then it should be done within this method call - Hibernate.initialize(Object). Do not mutate the PageElement here otherwise changes may inadvertantly be saved to the database. Updates to PageElement should be done in Editor.commit(PageElement).

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        pageElement - the attached page element.
        See Also:
        Hibernate.initialize(Object)

      • isModelDataDirty

        public boolean isModelDataDirty(EditorUI editorUI)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Return true if the model data is dirty.
        Specified by:
        isModelDataDirty in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        editorUI - the EditorUI. This should not be stored or referenced outside the scope of the method call.
        Returns:
        true or false.

        Specified by:

      • validate

        public ValidationState validate(Notifiable errors)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Validate the UI state in preparation for saving changes. This is always called after Editor.createUI(EditorUI), Editor.isPageElementDirty(EditorUI), and Editor.isModelDataDirty(EditorUI).
        Specified by:
        validate in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        errors - container to add errors for display in the UI.
        Returns:
        the state. If an invalid state is returned, you should set a message in the specified MessageContainer so that the user knows how to correct the situation.

      • validate

                                       Notifiable errors)
        Validate XHTML.
        Parameters:
        xhtml - the XHTML.
        errors - container to add errors. Optional.
        Returns:
        the validation state. Returns ValidationState.invalid_modeldata on error.
